Author: AdaMiner#4212
Content: I'm using the hte agama winsows wallet. I want to transfer my wallet from one PC to another. How would I go about that making the transfer and keeping my address?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: I will recommend backing up your wallet.dat file , do this once your wallet is shut down...you can save it in a usb or encrypted folder inside this device. Once you are in the new computer you can locate this same wallet.dat file inside the userdata directory ... this is also explained here https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000025198-how-to-backup-restore-komodo-or-assetchain-wallet-dat/en

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you have more assetchains aside from Komodo you should also back up the wallet.dat files for those assets as well.

Author: AdaMiner#4212
Content: @Hermes Thank you

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: ok let me know if you need any other help with the guide....also is recommended to save the private keys of the addresses that hold your funds just in case...

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I've been getting this error for about a week now while trying to manually install Komodo.

```
checking whether bswap_32 is declared... yes
checking whether bswap_64 is declared... yes
checking for MSG_NOSIGNAL... yes
checking for visibility attribute... yes
checking for Berkeley DB C++ headers... no
configure: error: libdb_cxx headers missing, Bitcoin Core requires this library for wallet functionality (--disable-wallet to disable wallet functionality)
Makefile:556: recipe for target 'config.status' failed
make: *** [config.status] Error 1
```

I've repeatedly done `git clean -f` and repeatedly run the `./zcutil/build.sh` file, and I've also done the `sudo apt-get install build-essential pkg-config libc6-dev m4 g++-multilib autoconf libtool ncurses-dev unzip git python zlib1g-dev wget bsdmainutils automake libboost-all-dev libssl-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libgtest-dev libqt4-dev libqrencode-dev libdb++-dev ntp ntpdate vim software-properties-common curl libcurl4-gnutls-dev cmake clang` command to make sure I have all libraries installed.

No luck, yet. 

The daemon was working fine before attempting to update.

Author: habship#2279
Content: Hello, I'm currently using Agama OSX wallet. I recently downloaded the most recent one (0.2.43d) and transferred a wallet.dat backup from my USB to the appropriate filepath. However, it's been taking forever to synchronize (balance is zero, Komodo daemon is finding the "best chain"). Am I doing something wrong? How long does this take to synchronize fully?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @habship  This depends mainly in the resources of the machine , has it already loaded some blocks or it is still loading the best chain ? How long has it been since the daemon started?

Author: habship#2279
Content: I restarted the wallet, but before it was on for almost 24 hrs. When I quit it was cycling through various blocks

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: cycling through various blocks...that means it had already loaded some blocks...so it got stucked and it went back to activate the best chain?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if you left the daemon open for 24 hours it should have already loaded the full chain ...unless you had an ISP issue ...while it was running .

Author: habship#2279
Content: I think so, unfortunately I don't remember exactly what the message was since I quit. Right now the wallet is saying "Komodod is down!"

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: that seems to be a corrupted data issue...when you close down Agama make sure you close it in the correct way  https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024522-how-to-shut-down-agama-native-mode-to-avoid-corrupted-data/en

Author: habship#2279
Content: Okay, I will try that, thanks!

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You could try doing a reindex of the blocks  https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024520-reindex-komodo-blockchain-with-agama/en to see if that helps...if not you will need to do a resync from scratch  https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024513-agama-windows-guide-how-to-resync-from-scratch/en as showed in this guide.

Author: habship#2279
Content: resyncing from scratch will not erase my wallet right?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: no...you will only in that erase the blocks and the chainstate files...the wallet.dat file doesn't need to be touched.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Bryan_Beus  that's a little strange...so you haven't been able to upgrade to the new version

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: no

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: you seem to have downloaded the correct dependencies..and  you are using the dev branch right?

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: correct

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: the error appears when you try to execute  ./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: trying to see what could be the issue here....you have already tried erasing everything and doing a fresh installation basically...

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: it seems this can be the issue : checking for Berkeley DB C++ headers... no

Author: habship#2279
Content: Hi Hermes, I attempted to resync (deleted all coin data) but the error message ‚ÄúKomodod is down‚Äù still appears.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Can you check if komodod is being blocked by any AV or Firewall ?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Try to see it  in the Activity Monitor

Author: habship#2279
Content: What am I looking for in the activity monitor?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: the process komodod...should launch when you launch the native mode of the wallet.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if that process is not running it means it could be blocked by another program.

Author: habship#2279
Content: Okay I don‚Äôt see it on the activity monitor

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: after launching native mode right?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if that's correct then something could be blocking komodod from starting .

Author: habship#2279
Content: Yes, I‚Äôm going to see if anything is blocking it. It may take awhile so I‚Äôll have to follow up tomorrow. I appreciate all your help though!

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
habship#2279
Content: Blocks are downloading! Had to reinstall Agama

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: funds are safe in wallet, and you need to know good practices how to safe guard wallets

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
we have chain of testers in komodo, we are taking proper care before we release build.

simple funda, if you have private key/ seed you are safe in wallet, not in komodo any btc compatible coins it applies üòä

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: @criptobear write your seed phrase down with a pen on a piece of paper. practice logging out of and into your wallet with that phrase. if you make one typo it will generate a completely different address and may freak you out a little. but that phrase will give you access to your funds even if you lose wallet.dat, computer, nuclear bomb, whatever. you can always rely on the phrase.

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
if you not know, Agama wallet provided us four different ways to safa guard wallet and ppl still overlook those life saving features.

1 ) Seed
2 ) password pin using encrypt seed
3 ) private key
4 ) Qr code of private key for your address

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: is there a way to fix having only 1 connection with Agama instead of 8 ? version 0.2.43d on Windows

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: it's not happening to me, it's a guy in the italian channel

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
remove `maxconnections=1` line from komodo.conf file and restart the wallet
komodo.conf file is located in `%appdata%/komodo/` directory

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: ok thanks!

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: recommended way, is to keep `maxconnections=1`  only on windows untill wallet is fully in sync, after restart it will automatically rests to default

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: he says synching was 8% in two days and he has fiber connection

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: if you remove that setting it would be high on bandwidth usage, this is known windblows issue somehow acts weird. May i know about his system resources?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I asked, he says it seems to work much better now

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
alternative way to overcome this scenario,  is Bootstrap way
https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000025745-komodo-bootstrap/en

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: okie  kool @KomodoWorld

Author: habship#2279
Content: Hello, I am a little confused about the Komodo rewards. When do rewards stop accruing? I‚Äôve been told that rewards are address specific. So if a single address generates the 5% return in a year, does this mean you need to send the balance to a different address to continue a accruing the 5% interest?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You need to claim your reward once a month , if not the accruing will be capped until you claim again, you can claim the reward with the same address. The reward mechanism works with the spending of a UTXO . If the UTXO meets the requirements the reward can be claimed. The claim button is just a shortcut to making a transaction to your same public address. And also when the UTXO meets the requirements you can claim it by sending your chosen balance to an address of your choosing. @habship

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Here is a guide on how they workhttps://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000025304-how-rewards-work-dev-notes-/en

Author: habship#2279
Content: I see, so as long as I claim the rewards once a month I can collect them indefinitely without making any additional transactions?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You don't need to make any additional transaction just use the claim reward button.

Author: habship#2279
Content: Thanks!

Author: [Dev] Alex#5249
Content:
@SHossain ```"code": -4,
"message": "Change 0.32 not allowed. When protecting coinbase funds, the wallet does not allow any change as there is currently no way to specify a change address in z_sendmany."```

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: what is the exact command you are using?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
use 
```
./komodo-cli -ac_name=PIRATE z_shieldcoinbase "*" zcxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
```
change `zcxxxx` with your a addr and PIRATE with any coin you are using.
